column5: I agree with you. I‚Äôm almost 3 years out from my partner dying (by suicide) and I‚Äôm finding happiness each day. Some nights are rough when i relive old moments, but I don‚Äôt dwell in the pain like I used to. I second counseling or therapy of some sort. Also joining fb groups helps me; ‚Äúoption B‚Äù is a good one.

You can enter at Low water bridge in front royal (Morgan ford bridge). Then can exit at Treasure island if it‚Äôs back open. We did it in floats and it took about 5 hours. It‚Äôd go faster on kayak though I‚Äôm sure.

Came here to say the exact same thing. I used to use an excel spreadsheet almost identical to OPs for years; and would plan out my checks for the next 4-6 months. But I NEVER got ahead, and always overspent and never knew where my money was going. I switched to YNAB less than a year ago and have paid off all my debts, cut back on grocery and ‚ÄúMisc‚Äù spending habits, AND saved an emergency fund. Totally worth the yearly cost imo. Took some getting used to, but I‚Äôm obsessed now. I didn‚Äôt use the import tool; I prefer entering my transactions manually because it helps me to hold myself accountable for my spending and it makes me more conscious of what I‚Äôm buying. I love that ynab allows me to see where my money is going; and what I can do to change that.
This was very helpful. I‚Äôve saved it to my computer. Thank you!

Thank you!! I never thought I‚Äôd get here, I‚Äôve been in debt since I was 18 and got my first credit card .. so that‚Äôs 13 years of loans and credit card debt!  My car is 2018, so I likely won‚Äôt need a new car, however I do have a car maintenance/repairs budget set already that I could probably increase a bit.
I‚Äôm so bad with this. I guess I need to learn more about investing. I see that come up a lot.

Wow. Just, wow. This is perfect. My daughters were 2 and almost 4 when their dad accidentally shot himself (but it was ruled suicide, due to depression and trauma in his past). The oldest has been asking what happened. I say there was an accident and usually don‚Äôt elaborate but she‚Äôs recently (6yo now) been asking what kind of accident,  what happened. And I just never know how to tell her. Thank you for this. Putting it in my back pocket.

Also, in alignment with meal planning - I‚Äôd like to recommend grocery pick up services.  I know I have low self control when I see ‚Äúgood‚Äù deals at the store when I shop. Therefore, I‚Äôve been using Walmart grocery pick up for 95+% of my groceries (I buy a few things in bulk at Costco). by doing this, I know I‚Äôm ONLY getting what I need for the week - nothing more. I‚Äôve saved a quite a bit of money and have had less waste. And also time - I‚Äôm in and out of the pickup line in 5 minutes, versus an hour spent physically shopping if I hadn‚Äôt used the service. 
I‚Äôm not sure about other stores, but Walmart doesn‚Äôt jack the price up for using this service. Blueberries are $2.99 on the pick up app, And $2.99 in store. I tested this because I know instacart adds a fee to each item and it ends up being way more expensive.

Yes, this. Ironically, my bf passed away the same day as my current boyfriends birthday falls ... i felt very weird about it at first but very quickly,  I decided to look at it as a blessing. A chance to lighten the sting from that terrible day.  I will still mourn the loss, but I have something major to celebrate - this amazing person in my life. 
I think he needs some therapy to learn to cope with grief from losing his gf but also to learn how to grieve WHILE loving a new person. Grief doesn‚Äôt ever really end, it‚Äôs a dance between the old and the new, and that day will probably always be pretty crappy  - but he also has something positive to celebrate as well.

Lmfao I did this when my daughter was 2 weeks old. I farted and blamed her after my partner smelled it. And then HOURS later my guilt was eating at me so I had to confess that it was me hahah NAH.  but you should just tell him, it‚Äôs a funny story and he‚Äôll likely laugh.
This is like a girl saying they won‚Äôt date you bc you‚Äôre circumcised (or not), or your dick is 0.5‚Äù too small or ‚Äúnot thick enough‚Äù. That‚Äôs stuff you have no control over. YTA.

If she won‚Äôt let you drink for fear of other girls being around - I think your issues are deeper than you are admitting my friend. She has no trust in you; and that will go no where in a relationship and will only cause issues. You shouldn‚Äôt have to not drink and have fun with your friends because she‚Äôs insecure. 
And  she wants to limit your hobby, what?! I could understand if you guys were physically hanging out (since you are LDR), and she wanted some undivided attention apart from your gaming ... but who the f cares if you game? Are you even truly happy in this relationship? How long have you guys been together.
Just a quick question. She won‚Äôt ‚Äúlet‚Äù you drink? Is she your mom? Does she control you in other ways as well?
Yea YTA. no form of birth control is 100% full proof .. If you don‚Äôt want kids, don‚Äôt have sex.

I am so sorry you‚Äôre feeling down. I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs got to be hard to feel like you‚Äôve somehow failed but please be easy on yourself. You have not failed. You are amazing and you are all your child needs right now. She knows you and loves you for you.  Spending time together is so important, even making up fantasy stories as you go! I did a quick search and found some Braille kids books. Is that an option for you? Or maybe those with extra large print? Keep going. You are doing GREAT. I promise. The fact that you try to memorize the books before you read them with her just proves that you are the perfect parent - don‚Äôt sell yourself short :)

I‚Äôm a chick.. I‚Äôm only attracted to, and have only dated males. But yet I watch lesbian porn. I don‚Äôt think it usually means anything in that regard. But either way, you‚Äôll never be able to ‚Äúforget‚Äù you saw it. It will eat at you. You should ask her, just be honest. Tell her you were looking at old family photos and came across her porn stash and wanted to ask about it. but be sure there is no judgment.

I love your outlook. Keep at it. I‚Äôm a little over 2 years out and I still have rough days, not as often thankfully. But I know in my heart I‚Äôm living how he would‚Äôve wanted me to; that‚Äôs all I can do. Excited to follow your journey üíô

She breaks up with you when she wants to fuck other people. Cut your losses. You deserve someone dedicated to you, not someone who strings you along until she wants to try something new. History is repeating itself. Get out and find your own happiness. She sucks.

She was brain dead. There was literally nothing they could do after she got to the hospital. And yes, it sucks, I‚Äôm not saying it doesn‚Äôt. My fianc√© died from brain trauma resulting in brain death and I can tell you - it‚Äôs not fun and no, I‚Äôm not ‚Äúthrilled‚Äù he died.  but at the end of the day, I know his heart is still beating (and SAVED a young father of 3!). As a father himself, I‚Äôm sure he‚Äôd never want another family to go through what we went through. So when nothing could have helped him, I‚Äôm thankful he was able to give life to others, so they don‚Äôt have to experience this pain.  Until you‚Äôve experienced a great loss and the impact organ donation has, back off.

Edit. Spelling is hard.

I‚Äôm gonna go with YTA, slightly. I can understand being hurt (and his lack of communication sucks) .. but it‚Äôs his child. Who he sees only once a week. So 4 days a MONTH he gets to see his kid. I‚Äôm dating someone who only gets his daughter on the weekends and I know that she always comes first. It‚Äôs a part of parenting. Can you go hang out with him after the child is in bed? That‚Äôs how we made it work for the first year + of our relationship. I‚Äôd go after and we‚Äôd do a late dinner and watch a movie after his daughter was in bed.

Edit: by ‚Äúlate dinner‚Äù i mean - at this house. We didn‚Äôt leave his child at home. In case that wasn‚Äôt obvious.
She physically saved 7 lives through organ donation. A 2 year old and a 3 year old were able to see because they each got one of her eyes. What a gift!

I‚Äôm not sure the articles ever specifically  did. I watched that info on one of her mothers fb video updates while Raven was still in the hospital. I think the family has chosen not to disclose that via media yet because I‚Äôm sure they can imagine the backlash and the mean words people would say. Which would only intensify the guilt the father I‚Äôm sure is already facing.  They may in the future, just to bring awareness about the dangers of throwing a kid up into the air like this. But it‚Äôs so raw and fresh right now.

I‚Äôve been following a story for 2 weeks out of Texas where a dad, who‚Äôs done this exact thing with his daughter since she was a baby, was saying goodbye to her, tossed her up, and she leaned back weird and he was unable to reach to catch her. She was 6. She died from head trauma. Raven Goff is her name, if you‚Äôd like to look up her story. It can happen, even when we don‚Äôt expect it. Even when it‚Äôs something we do several times with no bad consequences.

My father in law shipped my fianc√©‚Äôs to me via usps in a thick glass jar, which he put into a ziploc style plastic bag in case the jar were to break. But it was very well packaged (styrofoam and bubble wrap, etc) so it would arrive safely, and it did.  It may be helpful to talk to a therapist if you‚Äôre able. also, I read the book ‚ÄúOption B‚Äù - it‚Äôs about a woman losing her husband, but would work with any kind of loss really. Living with Rae in your life physically was option A, but you don‚Äôt have a choice now but to live Option B - and you can totally kick ass at it. It helps you learn how to. Good luck. Sending you positive thoughts!!!
This is awesome. What CC do you use to earn points? Mine accrue points but at a low rate and I could never pay for a trip with them. I‚Äôd love to do this!

I‚Äôm so sorry for your loss. Have you tired writing him a letter? To just get your final thoughts and goodbyes out?  Or even a journal where you can write your favorite memories of him.  Also, I wonder if his mom would be willing to give you some of his ashes ... I gave my fianc√©‚Äôs two best friends (more like brothers), a share of his ashes so they could have it to do as they please (one spread it over water since he was a sailor, the other has it on his gun shelf at home in an urn (they liked shooting together). You can have things made out of small amounts of ashes - rings, necklaces, even paper weights or just shelf decor.
His little ice slide right after picking it up is adorable lol
WOW. This is completely selfish and really shitty. You‚Äôre still dating this guy but admit to cheating on him and possibly getting pregnant by someone else? I feel bad for your poor bf. YWBTA.

Wow what a hard day for you. Sending you positive thoughts. My dad died when I was 13, and his was my first funeral also. We had an open casket as well and it is so hard to explain but I think you nailed it - like a wax figure... not the father you knew. Hang in there. It‚Äôs been almost 16 years for me and, while it still sucks SO bad, and there are days I just wish I could call him up to chat - it does get easier to breathe. Allow yourself to feel sad, Angry, at peace. Anything you feel is normal. Grief has no timeline and no straight lines. 

Also, I‚Äôd recommend getting a journal and writing down any and all memories you can remember. It‚Äôs crazy how those can fake and not be as bright as time goes on, and that‚Äôs a tragedy.

Her feelings are valid, sure. But so are her mothers. I‚Äôm sure not many people  want to see their mother move on with someone after their father dies (I know this from experience after my dad died at 13). My mom
Got engaged 5 years after my dad died and even that devastated me. HOWEVER - now I‚Äôve experienced the opposite end of the spectrum. My partner of a decade died and I started dating less than a year later. That doesn‚Äôt make me a shitty person. Just like it doesn‚Äôt make her mom shitty. It seems their relationship was dying before he even did anyway. Her mother has the right to grieve and heal in whatever way she chooses to.  NAH.

Start with Pinterest: ‚Äúeasy dinner recipes‚Äù and similar. I find a ton of easy to follow and  quick recipes on there! My mom never taught me. I‚Äôm 31 and still learning but - you can do it! When you find recipes you like,  write them down in a notebook so you can look back on them at times (this is nice to have because you already know they‚Äôre good!). Good luck! It‚Äôs never too late to learn :)

Mine was on a podcast once as a guest appearance for a video game he was a moderator for... it‚Äôs so strange hearing him in that element (I‚Äôm not a gamer), but the jokes he cracked and his laugh .... man, It took me back. I love listening to them so much! I‚Äôm glad you have the video(s) of your husband is to go back and watch. What a sweet keepsake.
I‚Äôm hoping to get my laundry room renovated this summer to include a specific counter for folding laundry  .. until then, a folding table isn‚Äôt a bad idea haha

Oh, she does eventually take over. It‚Äôs just a slow, sneaky process. She puts both front paws up and looks at me like she‚Äôs not doing anything wrong... prompting me to hurry up before all my folding goes to waste lol:  https://imgur.com/gallery/XAC4Vjp

I‚Äôm really sorry for your loss. It‚Äôs never easy, especially when they‚Äôre so young :( my partner died at 28. I couldn‚Äôt see a clear path after that either, and was on auto pilot for quite some time. Things were very blurry and bland. I‚Äôm 2.5ish years out now and it‚Äôs better. Not easier just ... not so heavy all the time. Sure I still cry and there are still moments grief overtakes me, and that‚Äôs okay. Allow yourself to feel and grieve. Try to honor him in some way- can you write him a letter? Draw something? Play a video game he liked? Eat at his favorite restaurant? Im sending you virtual hugs. Take it one day at a time my friend.

I‚Äôm so sorry for your loss. These next few days and weeks will likely be a blur. You‚Äôll be running on auto pilot. Allow yourself to feel how you feel, accept your emotions. Things will seem heavy at first, but over time they get a little lighter. It won‚Äôt always be dark. I‚Äôm 2.5 years out and the first year was the toughest. About halfway through the second I feel like I was finally able to be ‚Äúhappy‚Äù. It‚Äôs just a new kind of happy. Hang in there, live minute by minute right now if you need to. Hugs to you.

Def not normal at all. My ex would go through my phone while I slept and delete and block guys from my fb and snap. Guys I had been friends with since HS and never had any relations with. For no reason. Your bf is extremely insecure and lacks respect for you. Get out while you can. I‚Äôm in a trusting healthy relationship now and it‚Äôs way better than i could‚Äôve imagined. Trust me. You don‚Äôt deserve that, he‚Äôs being possessive and obsessive. Break it off before it gets too far.
Agree with this! That specific podcast helps me so much.

Have you tried diffusing essential oils? Or, I will put a few drops of cedarwood on my sheets and that seems to help. Also, listening to reallyyyyy boring podcasts really help also. There‚Äôs one I like that‚Äôs very weird and he doesn‚Äôt really talk ‚Äúcorrectly‚Äù so it makes it easy for your brain to not focus on it. It‚Äôs called ‚Äúsleep with me‚Äù.

also - you did honor your vows. Too death do you part. Unfortunately your sweet wife is no longer here. But remember - she died, you did not. You are here. You only get one life. You‚Äôre right, her loss will impact you forever. There‚Äôs never a ‚Äúright‚Äù time for dating nor is there a ‚Äúright‚Äù way to grieve. Trust your instincts and your gut and you‚Äôll be okay :)

I made an online dating profile 2 months out, (honestly I didn‚Äôt want to date, but missed that touch and intimacy.. ). It was a mistake for me. I wasn‚Äôt ready and ended up hurting more. I then Waited til about a year after he passed, and met an amazing man who is just absolutely perfect for me. It allowed me time to heal, and grow, and be independent; slowly ensuring I was ‚Äúok‚Äù before actually giving myself to someone else. We‚Äôve been together 16 months now and the timing was perfect. But - only YOU know what you need. There is no shame in wanting the physical touch of another human. If it brings you comfort, by all means, you do you. NO ONE should judge you, because they are not in your shoes. Just be careful.
My appointment is tomorrow! I‚Äôm so anxious but so excited. Proud of you! Hope it works quickly and you feel better.

First, I‚Äôm so sorry for your loss and anger can be a very normal side effect of grief. Second, are you in the US? Have you checked into social security for your son? My girls‚Äô dad passed away 2 years ago when they were 2 and 4, and he did not have insurance for them to get. but they DO get a social security payment every month that is used for their school/daycare/clothing/sports and activities, and other misc needs. They will get that until they are 18. Throwing that out in case you do not currently get that for your son, but are able to collect it for him. Hang in there!

First, so sorry for your loss. Second, it is not ‚Äúwrong‚Äù to feel how you‚Äôre feeling. Please give yourself grace and let yourself feel the way you need to feel.  After my fianc√© died I cried after the first time I laughed, because I felt so incredibly guilty for being able to continue on, and laugh, while he couldn‚Äôt.  The guilt remained for a while. It was just past a year, maybe a year and a half, when I stopped truly feeling overwhelmingly guilty for things. His dad told me around that time ‚Äúhe died, you did not. It‚Äôs okay to grief and be sad. Just never forget: You are here to live - do it, for him. Keep him with you and take him on these experiences. But never DONT have experiences, you only have one life - live it as full as you can‚Äù and that really helped. Hang in there, it doesn‚Äôt get easier; but you certainly will get stronger.

My fiances was accidental to the head too. I also wonder if he even realized it went off. Or if he felt anything. He was breathing on his own when the ambulance got there but totally went down hill. He was loudly snoring, like he was just knocked out. But with the damage to his brain, it‚Äôs likely he didn‚Äôt even realize, he was basically ‚Äúgone‚Äù in that moment. That‚Äôs a hard pill to swallow bc I wish he would‚Äôve just been fine and woken up to a terrible accident that required some OT or something. It‚Äôs been 2 years and I still picture it. So sorry for your loss of your brother.

Possible trigger: GSW       
My fianc√© died due to a gun shot wound, to the back right side of his head. I was there within seconds of it happening.  He was breathing, but I was trying to stop the blood. He spent 4 days in the hospital before finally passing due to the trauma and I will NEVER get those images out of my head. I struggle with having seen him that way. That was NOT him. It‚Äôs not what he looked like. It‚Äôs not the person I knew.  If she was in an accident, I imagine she likely had some major trauma as well. I think honestly remembering her in her normal self would be way less traumatic than seeing her with those injuries. Either way, it definitely sucks and is not easy. I‚Äôm sending you positive thoughts and virtual hugs.

NTA. Your sister sounds like she may be suffering from pretty major PPA. I‚Äôd suggest she sees her docs for meds and/or therapy. Either way, it‚Äôs not your responsibility to support her not working.
Looks like a whole home water filter. Mine is similar, just shorter.

I have. I took him back several times because we had two kids and a decade of history. And no, it wasn‚Äôt successful. It always resulted in the same cycle. I missed him too but I can tell you, being alone and with other people, make you sort of realize what you settled for in the past. I‚Äôm in a healthy and happy relationship now that has great communication and trust. You deserve the same. Can you say if you got back together, would you trust her? If she went out with friends, would you worry the whole time who she is talking to at the bar? If she‚Äôs texting a lot, would you trust it‚Äôs not another guy?
Great call out, thank you!

Absolutely report it.  Your duty as a parent is to protect your kid - no sympathy for the 14 year old. Praise your daughter for telling  the truth and make sure to reaffirm your children that it is NOT their fault and they are not in trouble. Teach your 6 year old about good touch and bad touch if you haven‚Äôt already.

Exactly. And along the lines of this ... the trust will be completely broken for you. If they‚Äôre out at night with some friends, you‚Äôd automatically assume the worst. Been there done that. Not worth it.
Tbh I think they talk more than he‚Äôs letting on.. yikes

Oh wtf. So I‚Äôd be leery of HER. She has no boundary respect for you or for him if she took the liberty to do it on her own. How does she even know his job history well enough to create a linked in account without him knowing ..

Is it possible she‚Äôs just good with resume type things? My good friend (who works in HR) is better at writing than me, and I‚Äôd totally let them make me a LInkedIn account to help promote me better ... 
however - he should be open about it with you tho. That part definitely seems shady to me.

I love this so much. I have a photo of my dad wearing cut off jean shorts (they were even shorter than your dads lol yikes!) While he was grilling and it‚Äôs one of my favorites of him. It‚Äôs so nice to be able to look back and smile at these memories. Mines been gone 15 years (died when I was 14) and I still miss him every day.
I bet this was tough to read. Thinking of you today.

[what about something like this first pic??](https://www.etsy.com/GlisteningTruth/listing/241584027/free-shipping-welcomebelieve-sign?utm_campaign=Share&utm_medium=social_organic&utm_source=MSMT&utm_term=so.smt&share_time=1559624110000#) 
Move your house number and then add a tall bush and a vertical sign!

Here is a shorter version that I adore. 

[Nora McInerny ](https://www.facebook.com/hodaandjenna/videos/237764790104924/)

Our stories are very similar. Dated 10 years, he died  when we were both 28. Had two small kids together. 
I thought the same... I won‚Äôt ever be happy and I can‚Äôt ever imagine loving anyone else. But the truth is- you‚Äôre right, life likes to prove us wrong. I met someone and have been with him for almost a year and it‚Äôs just so amazing. He has truly saved me. He makes me happy. I did have those guilty feelings the first 6-9 months.  Why should I get to go on with life when he can‚Äôt? how can I happy when I lost my first true major love? And those feelings are 100% normal. But I will tell you this - realizing that HE died, I did NOT made the guilty feelings go away and allowed me to open up more and be okay with being happy with my current bf. I don‚Äôt deserve a miserable life because I lost him. I deserve happiness just like everyone else. A talk with his dad actually is what helped me most. He told me that, yes, he died, but that‚Äôs only one chapter in my book - not the whole thing. I will have other experiences and other moments. Yes, they won‚Äôt be with him. But they‚Äôll be MINE and I deserve to be happy and loved. And so do you! Your partner will  always be a part of you. If you have a chance, watch the ted talk video by Nora McInerny ‚ÄúWe don't "move on" from grief. We move forward with it‚Äù. It‚Äôs about her husband dying from cancer and then her finding someone new and moving FORWARD. Because you never move ‚Äúon‚Äù. It helped me so much!

I didn‚Äôt qualify because we weren‚Äôt married and Va doesn‚Äôt recognize common law. However - I have two small kids with him. 3 and 5. They BOTH get social security every month. My income did not prevent that. I use it for their daycare needs, school supplies or clothes, food, savings  for college, etc. I would not be able to live without it, as daycare is so costly and I didn‚Äôt have anyone close to help either. 
So I don‚Äôt have advice for survivor bens, but Definitely check with your local SS office about the kids.

Sorry you‚Äôve had a rough day. Must be something in the weather because I, too, have been really down today. Ironically- my fianc√© was THAT guy. Yet life took him away from his two little girls and I. Tomorrow night is 2 years and I find myself crying today, when I thought I was stronger than this. But here we are. 
Thinking of you and sending you positive thoughts. ‚ù§Ô∏è

You are not alone and your feelings are 100% valid. I have a 3 year old and 5 year old. Been solo parenting for 2 years (tomorrow, actually ..) when their dad died unexpectedly. ITS SO. HARD.  I often lose my shit and basically never feel like a good parent. It definitely takes a toll. Can you join a gym or local library that way you can get a break several times a week? Hang in there. We are all in this together. Message me if you ever need to let it out.

100% agree.  My fianc√© was only 28 when he died. I don‚Äôt think you‚Äôre being extreme at all. I think you‚Äôre just being prepared. None of us know when it‚Äôs our time; so better to do things just in case. Otherwise, he‚Äôd be left with none. I‚Äôve been taking videos for my daughters and sending them to an email for them to have when they‚Äôre older.

I am so sorry to hear this. PLEASE, if you haven‚Äôt already - make videos for your little girl. Could be videos of you speaking to her, or videos of you both (playing, singing,  literally ANYTHING). My daughters‚Äô dad died very unexpectedly when they were almost 2 and 3.5.  
I have ONE video of him dancing with them and they love watching it. My only wish is that we had more video or sound memories. Pictures are great - but nothing compares to them being able to hear his laugh and voice. Positive thoughts and prayers to you and your family.

First of all I‚Äôm so sorry for your loss. I found out my fianc√© was texting a girl, someone he had previously dated, the night he died and I wanted SO badly to read the texts ... what was he saying? Did he say he loved her? Wanted to be with her? Was he that unhappy with me? He took his own life (he was severely intoxicated). 
But then I think .... would reading those messages help me or hurt me. Would it provide me with any kind of closure .. at all? 
Probably not. It doesn‚Äôt change the fact that he‚Äôs gone. 

I honestly try to persuade myself of the best case scenario- like maybe he was telling her he didn‚Äôt wish to speak to her ever again because he loved me so much and wanted a life with me. 

Same for you.. I‚Äôd try to focus on thinking that he likely didn‚Äôt suffer.  He is flying high somewhere and his spirit is watching you and encouraging you to live a full life, in his honor.  

I finally learned that letting go of those ‚Äúwhat if‚Äôs‚Äù helped me heal SO much. I don‚Äôt drag myself down as much about it anymore. What‚Äôs done is done and unfortunately we can‚Äôt change what happened. And Knowing every small detail around the circumstances doesn‚Äôt change that :( 
Hang in there.

I‚Äôm 15 years out from losing my dad (I was 14) and I still feel like it‚Äôs hard around holidays and anniversaries. I hope you were able to make the most of your birthday yesterday. Thinking of you.
I just wanted to say you are very strong and I‚Äôm sending healing and positive thoughts your way. It sounds like a tough time. Hang in there.

I am so sorry for your loss. My fianc√© did the same 2 years ago next week, a father of two. I will tell you the first few weeks were numb for me as well. I felt like I was doing okay when I shouldn‚Äôt be .. and then it really hits.  
Also note, the coming year + will be a roller coaster of emotions. Allow yourself to feel what you need to feel. There is no right or wrong way to grieve.  It‚Äôs okay to be sad. It‚Äôs also okay to be sad in front of your niece and nephew. You, and those around them, will teach them compassion and love and empathy from this.  And most of all: resilience. You can show them its okay to mourn and grieve... and then grow from it. It can‚Äôt drag you down. Even though some days it feels like it might. Take those days minute by minute. It doesn‚Äôt really get easier, but you will damn sure get stronger. Lean on your family and loved ones harder than ever right now. 
My heart goes out to you. Hang in there.
Lol I didn‚Äôt take offense to it! No worries!!
Solid advice,  thanks! She is crate trained and loves her crate. It won‚Äôt fit in the back of my car though. Maybe I‚Äôll invest in a smaller one for travel.
That is the current solution :) hence the Mickey Mouse reusable plastic mat that I can just hose off when we make it home lol

I didn‚Äôt do CPR, but had to stop his bleeding (it was alot). I do have PTSD from it. I do feel like I contributed in some way - like if I held the wound tighter he‚Äôd still be here. It took about a year and a half for me to stop doing that to myself. I just had to realize nothing could be done. The guilt was extreme.  but it‚Äôs not my fault. Just like for you - it‚Äôs not your fault either. you did what you could. I‚Äôm so sorry you have to think about those moments, it does eventually get a little more bearable. Hang in there. Might I suggest therapy (EMDR May be good in your case) or even writing in a journal if that helps. For me, going to the gym helped release feel good endorphins. Also, CBD at night helps me be able to sleep and not just lay in bed thinking about that day.

We eliminated baby food all together and never used it. There‚Äôs a book called Baby led weaning that gives great advice for just starting on real foods. Helps them to learn to chew, rather than just swallowing pur√©es. Good for taste buds and development.  It‚Äôs also basically free, because they‚Äôre eating the same things you‚Äôre eating.

Cloth diapers have a decent upfront cost but can be used for the entire 2+ years of baby being in a diaper as long as they‚Äôre taken care of. Did it with my first and it was maybe $200? And she used them until she potty trained.

Edit: also adding:
shopping at cheaper stores like Aldi really saves us money. Meal planning. 

Reusable paper towels (I got some on amazon for like $15?) and I just Wash and reuse. paper towels are so expensive. 
So are paper plates - so I try to stay away from using those.

Early on after he died, I‚Äôd wish someone would crash into my car while I was driving just to end it all. I never wanted to take my own life, but was perfectly okay with an accident taking it. 
I‚Äôm almost 2 years out now and I am so thankful God didn‚Äôt answer those prayers of me wishing death. My daughters needed, and continue to need, me. I needed to grow and be independent. I needed to learn to live a happy (although very different) life. I‚Äôm grateful for every day now. Hang in there.

First, Your feelings are 100% valid and okay to be feeling. Second; months 6-12 were harder on me than the first 5 months after he died. Around the 6 month mark things felt more ‚Äúreal‚Äù in a sense. I was Independent, doing everything on my own... and I realized he was never going to be there again. The numbness wore off and I was angry and hurt more than I had ever been. 
Around 12/13 months, things started looking up. I felt happiness and didn‚Äôt feel guilty for it like I had the first year. I could laugh again, and enjoy life. My daughters and I talk about him and keep his memory and legacy alive. He will ALWAYS be a part of us. 
It gets more bearable, I promise. Hang in there. Try doing something for yourself - go to paint nights or redecorate a room in your home. The gym really helped me get back on my feet and out of my funk. I hated working out. But once I experienced the endorphins from it, I grew to love it. 
You got this. He died, you didn‚Äôt. You can still live your full life and enjoy it. Life is short (as we both know from experience), don‚Äôt let it pass you by! Find and do things YOU love. Or even things he loved, to experience those too in his honor. üíïüíï
I do wall sits or squats. Or, while brushing with one hand, I‚Äôll wipe down my bathroom counter or organize/put stuff away with the other hand lol
